snippet: The man who fatally shot a teenager in Missouri in August has told investigators that he feared for his life, according to officials.
abstract: Police Officer Darren Wilson, who fatally shot black unarmed teenager Michael Brown in Ferguson, Mo, reportedly told investigators that he was pinned in his vehicle and feared for his life as he struggled over his gun with Brown, but it remains unclear why Wilson emerged from vehicle and fired at Brown multiple times; officials say federal civil rights investigation is continuing, but evidence does not support charges against Wilson.

byline.original: By MICHAEL S. SCHMIDT, MATT APUZZO and JULIE BOSMAN
byline.contributor: Michael S. Schmidt and Matt Apuzzo reported from Washington, and Julie Bosman from Chicago.

lead_paragraph: The man who fatally shot a teenager in Missouri in August has told investigators that he feared for his life, according to officials.

headline.main: Police Officer in Ferguson Is Said to Recount a Struggle
headline.print_headline: Ferguson Case: Officer Is Said to Cite Struggle
